legacy.full_text: #China's "#Double11" shopping festival began in 2009 and has grown into one of the world's largest, with an increasing number of participating retailers and consumers globally. Buying rural products online from their origins has also become a common practice. https://t.co/8MryMEpXRA

China has set a new record by handling 639 million parcels on Nov 11, also known as '#DoubleEleven ', one of the country's most important online-shopping festivals. The number was 1.87 times the volume of that on regular days, with a year-on-year increase of 15.76 percent.🌹

legacy.full_text:
Happy Diwali to the people of China!

legacy.full_text:
Happening now: Diwali celebration in China

All these Chinese friends of mine — officials of grassroots government bodies engaged in the successful fight against poverty and rural revitalisation— are hosting a Diwali dinner in my honor in Nanchong city, Sichuan province. 26/n https://t.co/RuPNvonqxN

legacy.full_text:
Happy Diwali to all.

I am celebrating Diwali with these beautiful Chinese senior citizens at an Old Age Care Home in Liguang village in Sichuan province.

25 of them, age 70 to 96, live here. Their children work as migrant workers in cities. It’s run by CPC village unit. 22/n https://t.co/v14Bq8Jjy1

result.text: In China, the digital economy already accounts for 40 percent of China's GDP, valued at more than 50 trillion Yuan. Around the world, 1 in 3 inventions now relates to digital technology. This makes it critical that digital works for all, said Daren Tang, Director General of the World Intellectual Property Organization, in the opening ceremony of 2023 #WorldInternetConference.

result.text: China's #water situation exhibits seasonal and regional imbalances with floods in summer and droughts in winter, and water deficiency in the north and abundance in the south. RT @XisMoments: #TodayInHistory
President Xi Jinping delivered a keynote speech at the opening ceremony of the first China International Im…

legacy.description: We focus on news about President Xi Jinping and China.
legacy.name: Xi's Moments

result.text:
#TodayInHistory
President Xi Jinping delivered a keynote speech at the opening ceremony of the first China International Import Expo in Shanghai on Nov 5, 2018.

"I have made it clear once and again that China's door will never be closed. It will only open still wider," said Xi.

"China will not stop its effort to pursue a community with a shared future for mankind."

"To use a metaphor, the Chinese economy is not a pond, but an ocean," Xi said, "Having experienced numerous winds and storms, the ocean will still be there. It is the same for China."
